title: [BUG]When setback system time back, the fragmentation is going high
body:
**Describe the bug**

Redis version:6.2.11  with jemalloc
When I set system datetime back, i found the fragmentation of redis is keep going high, after the time reached the time i setting time backï¼Œthe fragmentation of redis will go down immediately.
(1)At the beginning:
root@78:~# date
Thu Sep 21 10:26:36 AM CST 2023

The fragmentation of redis :
65) "fragmentation"
66) "1.158626914024353"
67) "fragmentation.bytes"
68) (integer) 6567864

(2)Setting the date back:
root@78:~# date -s "2023-09-21 10:00:00"
Thu Sep 21 10:00:00 AM CST 2023

(3)Then the redis fragmentation keeps raising:
65) "fragmentation"
66) "1.9999270439147949"
67) "fragmentation.bytes"
68) (integer) 41421336
(4) When the time of the system reached Thu Sep 21 10:26:36 AM CST 2023, the fragmentation decreased:
root@78:~# date
Thu Sep 21 10:26:52 AM CST 2023
65) "fragmentation"
66) "1.159626914024353"
67) "fragmentation.bytes"
68) (integer) 6573864


**To reproduce**

Set system datetime back

**Expected behavior**

**Additional information**

Any additional information that is relevant to the problem.
